data.title: Intuit, Inc. v. FTC
data.meta_description: U.S. Chamber files coalition amicus brief arguing that the Federal Trade Commission’s administrative law judges are unconstitutionally insulated by multiple layers of removal protection.

U.S. Chamber files coalition amicus brief arguing that the Federal Trade Commission’s administrative law judges are unconstitutionally insulated by multiple layers of removal protection

April 22, 2024

U.S. Chamber Coalition Amicus Brief

Steven A. Engel, Michael H. McGinley, Justin W. Aimonetti, and Brian A. Kulp of Dechert LLP served as outside counsel.
